divs: sighting detailsstanding outside in the dark facing west we saw a large light in the sky. it was reddish \ orangish with a lighter border, roughly diamond shaped. perhaps 2 degrees of arc in width and 50% more in height. centered around 20-30 degrees above the horizon. it last 1 or 2 seconds. a second, smaller one - maybe 1\2 the size - appeared a second or two after the first in about the same spot. we might not have believed our eyes if weren't for the second coming along. they opened up then faded quickly. northern lights? probably not, since: they were in the west; they were quite regular in shape; they came and went quickly; there was no other activity of the sort before or after; la area is too far south; and there was no news the next day on the event that would have been expected if the lights appeared over the city that night. there was no motion. they just came and went.
trends: There have been 404 other sightings in Los Angeles
There were no other sightings in Los Angeles on or around May 1st 1958
Summary: Large red light in the West
